wikipedia_page.main: Edward Simms (10 February 1800 - 15 January 1893) was an English organist and composer.

response: * Edward Simms (1800-1893) organist of Wombourne Parish Church 1813-1821
* Edward Simms, (1800–1893), British organist and composer

Booth was born in Coventry, where he was taught music by Edward Simms, and subsequently studied at the Royal Academy of Music, under Henry Brinley Richards and George Alexander Macfarren.  In 1868 he became organist at Banbury's Wesleyan Chapel.  Several of his tunes were included in the 1887 Congregational Church Hymnal.Music and Theology in Nineteenth-Century Britain, ed. Martin Clarke (Ashgate, 2012), p 8  One of his works was performed at the National Fete of the Independent Order of Grand Templars at Crystal Palace in 1884.Michael Musgrave, The Musical Life of the Crystal Palace, Cambridge University Press, 1995, p 205
